titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Miss Hilton diary, 1867 June 14-1868 February 21
titlestmt.author: Processed by: Rubenstein Staff; EAD finding aid derived from MARC record using marc2ead_sectionA.xsl

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid derived from MARC record via marc2ead_sectionA.xsl, November 2021

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University

did.abstract: Manuscript diary of a 20-year-old woman, Christian name unknown, of Uxbridge, England. The author occasionally expressed dissatisfaction with her living situation with her aunt and uncle, but most frequently wrote of her social life and drawing and painting lessons. Many passages have been excised.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.p: Miss Hilton diary, 1867 June 14-1868 February 21, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.p: This finding aid was derived from a MARC record using a crosswalk defined in marc2ead_sectionA.xsl. The finding aid was generated as part of a larger project to digitize several thousand small collections housed in Section A, November 2021.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Miss Hilton was an English orphan. Niece of Reverend Rennell Molesworth.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Manuscript diary of a 20-year-old woman, Christian name unknown, of Uxbridge, England. The author occasionally expressed dissatisfaction with her living situation with her aunt and uncle, but most frequently wrote of her social life and drawing and painting lessons. Many passages have been excised.
